programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Aoki, Takemura and Ippo visit Kimura because he has a high fever; Aoki's and Kimura's life as delinquents is shown.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: A look at Aoki and Kimura's debut matches and how they became boxers and joined the Kamogawa gym.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Sendo comfortably beats Saeki, the speed star; Sendo wants a fight with Ippo; all the guys from the gym go to training camp in the mountains and meet Kamogawa's friend.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: The guys learn that killer intent can seem like a punch; Kamogawa and Nekota's history with one another is told; Takamura battles a bear; everyone finishes training camp.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.sub-title: The Kamogawa Gym Swings Into Action
programme.desc: Ippo spars with Shigeta, who is ranked fourth among Japanese featherweights and also uses southpaw; people find out about Takemura's fight with a bear; there is talk about Takemura getting a world title fight.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Aoki, Kimura and Takemura all fight their fights; before fighting, Takemura makes a grand entrance wearing a bear pelt and fights his match using only his left hand; Nekota starts teaching at the gym for a bit.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Sendo begins his title defense match with Shigeta, the southpaw user; Sendo fights Shigeta but gets angry with him as the fight goes on.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Ippo invites Kumi to the zoo; Kumi lets Ippo know that she was the one who wrote idiot outside the gym; Sendo's grandma tells Iimura Mari about Sendo's childhood and how he was brought up.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Ippo meets Volg after Volg gets lost; Volg tells Ippo that he boxes so that he can get money for his mother.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: The match with Ippo and Volg begins and the two boxers seem to get the edge over one another quite a bit.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: The fight between Ippo and Volg carries on; Ippo takes a lot of hits and gets knocked down a couple times.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: After many rounds, Ippo and Volg are both exhausted; after the match, Volg visits Ippo in the hospital and meets Ippo's mother.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.desc: Moving to a new town is tough, and with no friends, it can be scary; in Satsuki's case, that last part isn't helped any when she, her little brother, and three kids from school end up in the old schoolhouse, which happens to be haunted by ghosts.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: Akagami Aogami: A Hand Reaches Out from the Toilet.
programme.desc: Something is stinking up the town, and it isn't just urban reconstruction; a ghost has invaded the school's bathrooms, and it's up to Satsuki and the gang to find out how to put it back to sleep; the old book left by Satsuki's mom just might be it.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: The Curtain is Raised! The Cursed School Fine Arts Festival.
programme.desc: The big play is coming up, but the boy in the lead role is scared; he makes a wish for the gymnasium to catch fire--and it does; when the play moves to be held in the old schoolhouse, the boy wishes to be injured--and he is.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.desc: While in the old schoolhouse, Satsuki hears a haunting melody drifting through the halls; the only trouble is the lack of a pianist; if Satsuki hears the melody a total of four times, she'll die; the gang saddles up to put the ghostly piano to sleep.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: Ikki falls under the spell of a championship girls' team from Sweden.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: The adventures of Ikki and his Medabot Metabee and their hopes to become champions of the Robattle competitions.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: Ikki learns the origins of the Days of Darkness from Joe Swihan.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: The adventures of Ikki and his Medabot Metabee and their hopes to become champions of the Robattle competitions.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Dr. Robotnik invented a ray gun that's supposed to slow Sonic down for good; a family of sloths comes under attack from Scratch and Grounder, who use them to lure Sonic into the path of the Doc's ray.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Robotnik is in need of workers to build a huge monument of himself for Robotnik Day; he opens up the new Casino Night Zone to get gamblers to lose everything and have to work for him.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: A popular cartoonist Sketch Lampoon is imprisoned in Robotnik's prison.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Warpnik escapes from the Zone of Confusion and seeks revenge.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.sub-title: Close Encounters of the Sonic Kind
programme.desc: Sonic and Tails befriend a pair of aliens who crash land their spaceship on Mobius and help them rebuild their ship.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Robotnik's momma escapes from the home for mothers of villains and demands her birthday present.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: While Coconuts is permanent vacation, he runs into Boom-Boom, a long-lost Gorilla who thinks Coconuts is his father; Coconuts and Boom-Boom team to capture Sonic.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Outraged by a new hit song written about Sonic, Robotnik outlaws music on Mobius then takes pop star, Catty Carlisle captive.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Salesman Wes Weasely is selling weapons made by H.D.S.V.A.D.L. (Handy-Dandy Super-Villain Appliance Distributor Limited).

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Sonic and Tails learn the story of Lucas and Lucinda.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Scratch and Grounder have to deliver a train load of bombs to Robotnik; they meet up with Da Bears, who think they're Sonic and Tails.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Professor Dinglehopper's growth gun malfunctions and creates a cloud of growth gas.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Conan is captured; Lana, Dyce, and Jimsy navigate Industria's underground barracks and learn more about life during Lepka's rule.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Conan rushes to stop Lepka from flooding the underground community while Lana contemplates how she can help save the residents.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Lepka attempts to escape with his hostage Lana in tow, but Conan won't give up on his friend.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: As earthquakes rattle Industria, its residents fear that another cataclysm will occur; Lepka seeks to revive the massive warplane, Gigant, to make the world his own.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: As Lepka attacks, Conan infiltrates Gigant to try and stop him.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: The people of High Harbor rejoice as Dyce and Jimsy are finally rescued.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang steal a suitcase containing Costa Rican diamonds, only to find Inspector Zenigata inside the fake shipment; the real diamonds are being shipped to Puerto Rico inside a missile.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd Part 2
programme.sub-title: Search for the Treasure of Princess Kaguya
programme.desc: While Lupin, Goemon, and Jigen are all in Monaco, a beautiful young girl asks all three to bring her one fantastically exotic item.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd Part 2
programme.desc: Onabes' final voyage is nothing short of extravagant with a ship full of beautiful women and fine art; everything goes as planned when Lupin infiltrates the ship disguised as a woman until the bachelor he's trying to rob falls in love with him.

programme.title: Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water
programme.sub-title: The Mystery Of The Lost Continent
programme.desc: The conflict caused by the Blue Water haunts Nadia; the Nautilus heads to an underwater ruin to lay some of its crew members to rest, but as the crew pay their respects, Jean spots something.

programme.title: Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water
programme.desc: Jean tries to prove his worthiness when Nadia asks him to build another aircraft.

programme.title: Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water
programme.desc: The Nautilus sets sail for Antarctica and the crew has a run in with a nasty shellfish.

programme.title: Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water
programme.desc: Nemo introduces Nadia and Jean to his best friend, a talking whale named Irion.

programme.title: Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water
programme.desc: Jean's latest invention goes wrong and puts the Nautilus in serious trouble.

programme.title: Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water
programme.desc: The Nautilus is cornered by Gargoyle's battleship.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Dyce leaves Conan trapped in an Industria holding cell and escapes with Lana to the Barracuda; he finds cover in a dense fog but Lepka is close behind.
